_header: Saint Eustace the noble knight of heathen law was
Subjects: saints’ lives; Eustace, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Eustace in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn Eustas a noble knyȝt of heþene lawe wasAc ar he were
                    icristned men clupede him placidas…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…Ipassed it was an hondred ȝer & twenti after þat god
                    her comþat eustas myd is wif & is sones þolede
                    martirdom

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint eustace a noble knyȝt of heþen laue he wasac er
                    þan he cristenid was me cleped him placidas…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…nowidde [sic] we seint eustas al wit outen
                    steuenþat he preye for vs to god þat he graunte vs þe blisse
                    of heuen
Bod779.Attributed Title: Seint eustas & his wyf & his twey sonus (f. 164).

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
SEint Eustas þe noble knyȝt of heþene londe wasAke
                    are he i cristned were men cleopeden him placidas…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…Þus Seint Eustas mid is wif and mid is sones camTo
                    þe heiȝe Ioye of heouene þoruȝ strong martyrdom
BodLauMis108.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 393-402.

BodRawPoe225.First Lines:
Seynt Evstas a worthy knyȝt of þe hethene lawe was&
                    er he cristned were men callid hym placidas…
BodRawPoe225.Last Lines:
…Marie sone ihesu þat made alle thyngþou garunte vs
                    alle grace of þat meri duellyng

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
Saynte Eustas a noble knyght of he hethen laghe he wasAnd or he was
                    cristemman men calde hym PlacidasWith Traiane þe Emperoure he was
                    moste myghty knyghtffor he was maister of al his oste in ilk bataile to
                    fyght…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…Þus saynte Eustas & his wyfe with þaire sonnes
                    commeTo þe endles ioye of heuene thoru þaire
                    martirdome

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint Eustas þe noble kniȝt of heþene lawe wasAnd ar
                    he ycristned were me clupede him sire placidas…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Þus Seint Eustas and his wyf wiþ his sones comTo
                    þe ioye of heuene þorw strong martyrdom

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint Eustas a noble knyȝt of heþene lawe wasAc or he
                    cristnede were me clyped hym placidas…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…Ihesu for þe loue of hym ȝif hit be þy wylleNe
                    late ous neuer þe dede wurche þat we oure saules spille

BLAdd10626.First Lines:
…For summe þey nome & ladde forþe with hem faste y
                    boundeSumme þey raunsomed for hor lyf of many harde
                    pounde
BLAdd10626.Last Lines:
…Now god for hure aller love vs graunte þat
                    blysseÞat þey beþe inne & euer schullen & neuer
                    þer of to mysse. Amen

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
Seynt eustache a nobull knyȝte of hethen lawe he wasAnd ere
                    þane he crystened were menne called hym placydas…
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…Our fadur come & ladde vs forth full grette dole he
                    madeAnd þen we come to a grette water we myȝte not ouer
                    wade…
BlCottCalAII.Note: Ends imperfectly due to loss of folios following f. 139.
BlCottCalAII.Attributed Title:
Eustache (in upper margin, f. 137v, and as RT ff.
                        138v, 139v); Four poemes of St Jerom and St Eustace
                    (f. 1, sixteenth-century list of contents, encompassing 4623 as well)

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEyn eustas a noble knyȝt of heþen laue waser þan he icristneþ were me clupeþe him placidas…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …þus seint eustas wit his wif & wit his sones comto þe ioie of heuen þorou strong martirdom
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum lxxvii” added to right margin by later hand (f. 170).
BLCottJulDIX.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library  Cotton Julius MS D IX.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?ref=Cotton_MS_Julius_D_IX.
BLCottJulDIX.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 393-402 (lines 86-179).

BLEge2810.First Lines: SEint Eustas a noble kniȝt of heþene lawe wasAc er þan he ycristnid were me clupid him placidas…
BLEge2810.Last Lines: …Nou bidde we gode & seint eustas vor ins muchel blisseþe Ioie þat hij buþ in ybroȝt ne lete ous neuere misse

BLSto949.First Lines: Seynt Eusthas a noble knyht of heþene lawe wasAc ar þan he cristned were me clepyde hym placidas…
BLSto949.Last Lines: …þus seid Eustas myd is wif & myd is sones comTo þe ioye of heuene þoru strong martirdom

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt Eustas anoble knyȝt of heþen lawe wasBut er he
                    cristened was me cleped hym Placides…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…Ihesu for þe love of hem ȝif it be þi
                    willeLete vs neuer þe dede worche þat oure soule spille
                    Amen
Lam223.Note:
Below the explicit for the Legenda Aurea is ‘To a gode mon
                    of þe same is cleped Thomas of Wottoun’.
Lam223.Attributed Title:
Saynt Eustas (RT); Here endeþe legenda Aurea writen by R. W. of
                    þis toun (f. 296)

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Seint Eustace þe noble knyght of heþen lawe wasBut er he
                    cristned were men clept him Placidas…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…Þus seynt Eustace and his wif wiþ his wonys comeTo
                    þe blisse of heuene þorgh stronge marterdome
